intro: Lessingia germanorum subsp. euglandulifera, commonly known as the glandular Lessingia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This subspecies is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils in open habitats such as prairies and coastal dunes. The plant is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and insects.
